summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing logistical planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email indicates the Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting the affidavit, with plans for FBI agents to travel and conduct a multi-day search managed by the Evidence Response Team (ERT).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of investigation/target of search warrant
persons.context: The search warrant affidavit is being drafted for his private island off St. Thomas, indicating it is a target of the investigation.

events.title: Expected search warrant sworn out
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting a search warrant affidavit for Epstein's island, with the expectation the warrant will be sworn out on Friday in St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI travel to St. Thomas
events.description: FBI agents plan to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute the search warrant on Epstein's island.

events.title: Planned search of Epstein's island
events.description: The search of Epstein's island, managed by the FBI Evidence Response Team (ERT), is expected to take 1-3 days.

events.title: Planned FBI travel home
events.description: Thursday is noted as the expected travel day home for the FBI team after the search.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas as of August 6, 2019.
The FBI planned to execute the search warrant, with logistics involving travel on an FBI Q400 plane and a multi-day search managed by the Evidence Response Team (ERT).
The email indicates the investigation into Epstein involved his properties outside the continental United States, specifically targeting his island.
The planning was coordinated by FBI New York's Squad C-20, which handles Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking.
The document shows proactive investigative steps were being taken regarding Epstein's assets shortly before his death in August 2019.
